AndOperation.title: AndOperation

field_schema.description: Expected to be valid JSON Schema. Can be provided as a dict, a Pydantic model class, a tuple of a primitive type and a Pydantic Field, or primitive type
field_schema.title: Field Schema

ContainsOperation.title: ContainsOperation

ContainsSpec.description:
Specification for the `$contains` operation.

- `input`: The string to search.
- `substr`: The substring to search for.
- `case_insensitive`: If true, match is case-insensitive.
ContainsSpec.title: ContainsSpec

ConvertOperation.title: ConvertOperation

ConvertSpec.description:
Specifies conversion details for `$convert`.

- `input`: The operand to convert.
- `to`: The type to convert to.
ConvertSpec.title: ConvertSpec

EqOperation.description:
Equality check between two operands.

Example:
    ```
    {
        "$eq": [{"$getField": "op_name"}, {"$literal": "predict"}]
    }
    ```
EqOperation.title: EqOperation

GetFieldOperator.description:
Access a field on the traced call.

Supports dot notation for nested access, e.g. `summary.usage.tokens`.

Only works on fields present in the `CallSchema`, including:
- Top-level fields like `op_name`, `trace_id`, `started_at`
- Nested fields like `inputs.input_name`, `summary.usage.tokens`, etc.

Example:
    ```
    {"$getField": "op_name"}
    ```
GetFieldOperator.title: GetFieldOperator

GteOperation.description:
Greater than or equal comparison.

Example:
    ```
    {
        "$gte": [{"$getField": "summary.usage.tokens"}, {"$literal": 100}]
    }
    ```
GteOperation.title: GteOperation

InOperation.description:
Membership check.

Returns true if the left operand is in the list provided as the second operand.

Example:
    ```
    {
        "$in": [
            {"$getField": "op_name"},
            [{"$literal": "predict"}, {"$literal": "generate"}]
        ]
    }
    ```
InOperation.title: InOperation

LiteralOperation.description:
Represents a constant value in the query language.

This can be any standard JSON-serializable value.

Example:
    ```
    {"$literal": "predict"}
    ```
LiteralOperation.title: LiteralOperation

Message.description:
A message in a conversation with an LLM.

Attributes:
    role: The role of the message's author. Can be: system, user, assistant, function or tool.
    content: The contents of the message. Required for all messages, but may be null for assistant messages with function calls.
    name: The name of the author of the message. Required if role is "function". Must match the name of the function represented in content.
          Can contain characters (a-z, A-Z, 0-9), and underscores, with a maximum length of 64 characters.
    function_call: The name and arguments of a function that should be called, as generated by the model.
    tool_call_id: Tool call that this message is responding to.
Message.title: Message

NotOperation.title: NotOperation

OrOperation.title: OrOperation

Query.title: Query

TestOnlyInheritedBaseObject.description: A builtin object that inherits from another builtin object for testing inheritance.
TestOnlyInheritedBaseObject.title: TestOnlyInheritedBaseObject
